title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview

title: Analyst Interview

title: Communications Interview

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer called me two hours before scheduled interview time and only asked a few vague questions. Didn’t give me an opportunity to ask any questions myself, and was quite rude and short with me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about why you applied to this position.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Only cover letter and resume need to be submitted for the teaching assistant position. no in person interview required. It takes several weeks to hear back with an offer from the coordinator.

Interview Descriptions: Applied with a Resume and Cover Letter and received an interview offer within a week. Scheduled an inn person with 2 interviewers interviewing me; no other interviewees. The process was quite casual and informative when questions were asked. A week later they called me offering the position. Nice people, wouldn't mind interviewing with them again
Interview Questions: What is an skill you are currently working on?

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: A telephone call was there to confirm your identity and availability, and then a zoom interview was set up. In the interview, around 10 questions were asked and there were two examiners taking turns to ask you questions.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: A cover letter and resume are required. Ensure you explain your transferable skills and how it is relevant to the current role. that is the information i have at the moment
Interview Questions: No interview. A cover letter and resume are required. Ensure you explain your transferable skills and how it is relevant to the current role. that is the information I have at the moment

title: Career Education Specialist Interview

title: Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Warm, friendly, and open. The panel wanted me to succeed. It was an online interview which started on time. I didn't realize there would only be one round so I wish I had asked more questions before the interview closed.
Interview Questions: What has my ideal work environment looked like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: it was Less interview more of a conversation, and it felt quite relaxing and simple. In addition to the interview, I also had to complete a comprehension assignment which was quite straightforward
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Starts with a 30 mins screening call done over phone, then an hour long interview over zoom, and then finally sent an exercise to complete individually over the course of an hour which is then expected to be emailed back once the hour is up.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself? Why are you interested in this posting? What is the difference between scrum and kanban?

title: Board Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: This interview was for the Board of Governors department and there were two interviews and an in basket test. Three different interviewers showed up for each interview. Just technical and personality questions, nothing too hard.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with difficulties at work?

title: Undergraduate Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Presentation is normally required for similar positions at SFU, especially for Beedie. Longer than 1 hour and could be super stressful sometimes while straightforward and relaxed the other times. Normal interview process and questions for the similar positions.
Interview Questions: What is your advising strategy and how do you advise students?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: You wait for the zoom call and then you answer questions asked by the interviewer. Then they usually email you on the day if you get the position or not.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this research? 
Tell me about yourself and what can you contribute?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Organized and efficient. Preparation guidelines were sent in advance of the interview which was really helpful. Interviewers each had their own questions. They were well-prepared. They thanked me before and after the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you approve of the hybrid composition?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: For discrete math 101, no interview for this position is required, just upload resume and wait for the decision. Workload includes marking (the most part), proctoring and holding tutorials (2 hours per week).
Interview Questions: no interview for this position

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had fun giving the interview. It was easy, less stressful and exciting. Questions were from only my resume and my experience. I had fun talking to them about various things like resaerch, my finding my ongoing project, my ideas.
Interview Questions: what has been the toughest part in your research

title: Graduate Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to do a 10 mins presentation, followed by a series of questions from the members of the interview panel. Then I was asked to do a simulation and submit within 48hours. Interesting overall
Interview Questions: What does gender diversity mean to you?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Not pleasant. It seemed as though the questions were not tailored to the position. Panel interview did not have qualified interviewers to assess competencies and experience. Before the interview they asked you to prepare a plan for the department and present that to them.
Interview Questions:
What does diversity, equity and inclusion means to you?
How do you handle pressure? 
What would you do in the first year of work?

title: Manager of Engagement and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Quick and thorough. I applied for the job and got a request for an interview two days later. The interview was set up for two business days later. Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you managed conflict on a team before.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Online from overseas. General discussion about previous experiences. Introduction of the research project and the lab. Went pretty casual. First impression was good. Followed up with a proposal writing task.
Interview Questions: What was the performance of the system you built in your msc project?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: super easy! had to apply online, heard back within the week and by the end of the month I was working. the online website was easy to follow as well. first had a phone call and then a zoom interview
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Basic behavior questions that you get with in most interviews at large organizations  with some technical question at end that were basic and easy enough to answer. Overall the interview was very standard.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you were under stress at work and how you dealt with it.

title: teaching assistent Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: One round of online pre-recorded video interview. All behavioural questions. The interview was easy because you have time to prepare before answering each question. The process took less than 1 hour.
Interview Questions: How do you encourage student discussions

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 1 hour. It was with an interview panel where they asked standard interview questions. Asked for a lot of examples where I exemplified leadership skills, organization, multitasking, and meeting deadlines. Immediately after the 1-hour interview they gave me 1 hour to complete an online in-basket test that tested my basic admin skills (ex. how would you respond to this email, set up this excel sheet, etc. ). The in-basket test was four questions and I had 1 hour to complete it. Total all this took 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Q: Name a time you made a change at work and what were the results of that change

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had 24 hours to prepare a 10 minute presentation, followed by a 3 person panel interview. They said they would be in touch with me ASAP to give me an update on my status, and they never reached out even after I sent many follow up emails. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions:
They asked a lot of two-part questions which was confusing. 

I.e. Tell me about a large scale event you put on

title: Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call after a few weeks to schedule an interview. I only had one interview for an office assistant position with two interviewers. They asked technical and personality questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me your customer service experience

title: Data Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Several behavioural questions and then some technical questions regarding adaptive optics and image processing. Then there was a tour of the lab and facilities and machines you would be working with, followed by a meet and greet with the team. Overall very straightforward.
Interview Questions: What is the Fourier transform of a sinc function?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Good experience overall. Asked my interests in the subject for the research and my flexibility in  working hours. Did not ask many technical questions because it was an entry level position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your interest in this research topic. (was a statistical subject)

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: You will be invited to a panel interview and require to do an in-basket test. The in-basket test is about writing email skills, working with spreadsheets and pivot tables. However, you only have 30 mins to complete the test so that's the hard part but it's fine if you cannot finish all of the questions.
Interview Questions:
How to deal with confidential documents?
Example of your diplomatic skills?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (North Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 15 minutes. The employers would ask you a question and you need to answer them. The interview wasn't just about your skills, the job and the shop in general, it was more of helping the disadvantaged community and understand how they would feel. You have to be more sympathic with them.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me something about yourself 
-Why do you want to work here
-What do you know about this organisation
- What do you know about women shelter? 
- Can you describe how a victim of abuse would feel  when they arrived to women's shelter?
-Tell me about your previous job experience and how it applies to this position
- This organization have this gift certificate  for people who are in need of clothing (homeless, for example), they try to exceed the limit than this certificate's value. Can you describe what they would feel if they were in this situation? and how would you response to that?
- What are your strengths and your weaknesses

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Depends on which lab you apply for. But the whole process was quite simple. For the lab I applied for, I provided my background and why I want to join the lab.
Interview Questions: N/A

What would you do if a student seeking your advice admitted they were suicidal?

Tell us about a time you did something wrong that had negative consequences.

Tell us about an achievement you're most proud of.

title: IT Technician Interview

title: Master's Student Interview

Interview Descriptions: Brief phone call followed by an  in-person interview with two people, one of whom would be direct supervisor.  Was done at one the Vancouver campuses, about an hour long.
Interview Questions: Scenario based (ie: proposed changes to website)

title: Reaseach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Straight forward. Received the interview through email. One hour interview with two professors. Just about my project and thesis work.  Overall, it was a good experience. Nothing outside my domain
Interview Questions: Describe about your project. How things could have been done differently?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: 60 mins virtual interview followed by 90 mins in-basket test. There were three interviewers that took turns to ask questions. There were some general interview questions and some behaviour questions.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

Interview Questions: There was an in-basket test where you balance a till.

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview

Interview Descriptions: Pretty informal.  Most profs (assuming you meet the pre-requisites) are happy to field questions and are always looking out for new undergrads. The major hussle was submitting the documents before the NSERC deadline as the department left it late. Again it really varies with the prof but you might be given literature to pre-read before the actual research begins.
Interview Questions: Question : Tell me about yourself ? Also inquired about where I wanted my education to take me.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Professor asked me my experience with Python and C.
Also asked about my experience on my resume and other projects that I worked on.  Asked if I worked with PCBs.
Interview Questions: Did you work with microcontrollers before?

title: Research Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a casual interview, the interviewer asked basic questions about availability, hours that can be committed to the research lab,  and prior experience doing research. Academic experience and classes taken was also important
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Office Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Biggest weaknesses and strengths

title: Graphic Designer Interview

All the questions were quite straightforward, seemed almost as if they had been read off a "standard interview questions" website.
Interview Questions: explain your preferred management style

title: Business Analyst Interview

Interview Questions: What's your five year plan?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: nothing too technical, more about resume projects. talked about projects related to the position and experience to fit in the position. The overall process is casual. The interviewer is friendly and patient.
Interview Questions: resume project related

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line and through the department general office. There was no actual interview. It was mainly decided based on my previous education and research background and my recommendation letters as well.
Interview Questions: research background

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed in Vancouver Campus. There was a 30 mins pre-test related to excel in basic data analysis level. The interview took approx 1.5 hours with panel of 4 staffs. Questions are standard and common. The process is tedious. Ask a bunch of questions with the same meaning, they just followed the FIX procedure, instead of truly understanding what you said.  In the whole 1.5 hours interview, basically one of the interviewer just stared at you  during the whole time,  no matter if she was taking notes, or asking questions, she didn't stop staring at you  :)  ,  which I think it didn't show respect and did make you more nervous on purpose.  Most of the SFU staff are nice and friendly, I think it might just some of them  are having different working attitude. I wish you good luck of meeting a good one. Also, trust me, even they promise you the process would be one week and they will make a decision, you will only received the feedback 2-3 weeks after the interview no matter you send followup email or not.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you have conflict with your supervisor, and conflict with your colleague, how did you handle the situation, what's the cause and did you do this wrong? (in ONE question)

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Questions were easy and the interview panel was friendly. I guess it varies by faculty though. I had a manager who was new to the department and new to my line of work so it was extra easy to empress them.
Interview Questions: Explain how your experience is relevant to the position you are applying for?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, efficient, and easygoing. Questions were straightforward, and I was able to understand the interviewers. This is a great organization, and a good starting point for career building.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why would you want to work here?

title: Firmware Engineer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Go through 1 interview round with a senior manager, you will be asked about coding and solving problem skills, also there were some behavior questions. I was asked about Arduino coding experience and projects about Arduino
Interview Questions: Compiling coding language and Arduino project

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Surrey, BC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the professor who is the leader of the lab. Sat down with post-doc members and got asked questions about my background in coding and mechanical knowledge. Had a conversation about why i'm interested in joining the research group and what is my time availability.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this research field?

What are your goals? Where do you see yourself in five years time? ...

Why should I hire you? ...

Why do you want this job? .

title: Beedie School of Business Web Developer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of behavior questions and technical questions. The behavior questions included the standard questions such as why you applied, what do you know about the company and tell more about yourself.

title: Equity Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was easy . give a presentation and you will get it. don't worry about the interview process. just keep doing and give a presentation. It was primarily a behavioural interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 parts of the interview. The first is anwser questions concerning rate instrument operation skills and deal situation cases. The second part was a written part. The interviewee needed to give 3 solutions to 5 questions satisfying their specific requests
Interview Questions: How do you respond to a user who requests a service that is not impossible for the time being?

title: Business Analyst - Beedie School of Business Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a panel styled interview with two people. It started off with some general interview questions as expected. After which we moved onto the 5 minute presentation I was asked to prepare. In the last hour the interview became more technical and I was given some tests on ERDs (Normalizing databases at different levels) and I would need to specify what to improve on them. Lastly there was a quick SQL test on how to return information from those ERDs.

Both interviewers were incredibly nice and the interview was on the more conversational side. Don't be nervous and just have some process analysis experience to show/talk about.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your brand?

title: Secretary Interview

Interview Descriptions: Wait between application closing date and scheduling of interview can be lengthy and follows no apparent timeline. New online application system does not track the status of the competition (ie, filled or not).
Interview Questions: Most questions are behavior based, ie, "Tell us about a time you..." handled a difficult situation, came up with a creative problem to a solution, etc.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: First round over the phone (about 3 questions) second round presentation and behavioral for 45min - 1hour, including an in basket test that involved responding to a few student inquiries.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself (education, background, etc)

title: Summer Camp Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
We first introduced everyone to each other and then played some ice breaker games with a group of about 10. We were later divided according to the colour of our name tags and then further divided by the numbers on our name tags. 

In our group of 4 we played games which tested our cooperativity, which is super casual and as long as you contiribute and be friendly you’ll do fine. 

We then had a short 5 min 1 on 1 interview, where they asked us situational questions.

Overall everything was super chill and easy
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Used headhunter and interviewed four times.  The first was over the phone then followed by one with senior associates at the headhunting firm.  Then followed by two with SFU hiring managers.
Interview Questions: Mostly technical questions related to project management, architecture and engineering.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University

Interview Questions: There is a game happening, and every camper should be on site. Now you see one of the kids walks away to somewhere else, how would you approach and solve the problem?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Based on previous experience relevant to current project, skills, similar project management examples. After the interview I was asked to prepare a proposal for the project

title: IT Services/Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1 phone interview which lasted around 30 minutes. They went over my resume and what customer service skills I had obtained.
45 minute in person interview. I was interviewed by the manager personally.
Interview was 1-1.

Most of the questions were behavioural questions with some questions on customer service and computers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Academic Tutor Interview

Interview Questions: Can you briefly tell me your experience in doing tutor?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with one of the professors in his office. He took my on a tour of the campus, and later invited me to join him and the rest of his lab for a few casual drinks and snacks at one of the nearby restaurants. Very informal and fun!
Interview Questions: What are you interested in researching here, and how does your previous experience match?

title: Assistant Professor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Typical Academia interview. After the initial application and shortlist I was called for an interview with 3 profs and Assistant Dean. 7 days in advance they gave me a topic so that I could prepare a 30 minutes lecture on. The interview was overall short, 1h30.
Interview Questions: Which textbook would you use to teach this class

title: Data Analyst Coop Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It's a half-hour interview. We talked through my resume and they asked about my related experience. After that, they asked me several behavioral questions and I asked questions that I was concerned.
Interview Questions: Talk about your previous experience in this field?

title: PDF Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Surrey, BC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy straight forward I had three rounds, they wanted to see how I am motivated or if I leave the job in the middle of process. The questions are straight forward , and technical relevant to your field.
Interview Questions: What was your major accomplishment?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Surrey, BC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a two person panel inerview, with standard questions. The interviewers were not overly casual, it was quite serious. most of the questions were situational and there was a small demo that I was asked to prepare. There was no follow up interview etc. I heard back soon after.
Interview Questions: if your friend breaks a rule set by the library would you be lenient with them?

title: Electrical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: After submission of application, I got an email for the interview. Initially I cam in mechanical designer interview but they asked me if I would be interested in Electrical work. I agreed to that and  I was offered a job within next week.
Interview Questions: Explain your project experience so far?

title: PhD Student Interview

Interview Descriptions: Die Stellen werden im Normalfall nach einer persönlichen Kontaktaufnahme mit dem Supervisor vergeben. Interview Questions: Wann möchtest du Anfangen?

title: Operations Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2016

1. What is DNS and what it use for?
2. Can you briefly descripte the authentication of OSPF?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via email. Then the supervisor took a look at my resume and  then responded me and accepted to employ me as his assistant. Then the department accepted me and I got the offer from SFU.
Interview Questions: Why I want to research in this field?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: The job was offered through an application process which required quite an in-depth application involving transcripts, a list of awards, previous research/volunteer experience and letters of recommendation. Can be quite competitive depending on the department, and research project.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this particular research project? Describe any relevant course or research experience.

title: Co-Op Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Surrey, BC) in Feb 2016

Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, there were 3 questions asked by the computer simulator. After that, I had an interview with the hiring personnel. It was straightforward and there were no hassles. Overall, it took 14-20 days.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Weight Room Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Demonstrate an exercise. Make a program. Answer some easy questions. The general interview was very simple. Also to get a paid position at SFU Recreation, you must volunteer for at least one semester. So the role is not available to anyone, you must first spend time volunteering, where you are expected to show up to all your shifts and not be late and be reviewed by your peers.
Interview Questions: Demonstrate a squat.

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview has 3 Interviewer with their different concentrations. First guy, the senior developer, asked some general technical questions which test interviewee's general technical knowledge. Then the manager asked some work technique which test interviewee's ability in real work environment. The last guy gave out some detailed questions and the interviewee had 10 minutes before giving out a reasonable solution.
Interview Questions: How to deal with the situation that you are overloaded by work?

title: Biomedical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Surrey, BC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: the professor and two of gradual students interviewed me for my skills, projects and some technical knowledge that is relevant for this work. In addition, I brought an IPad to display videos and images for a few projects that I worked on.
Interview Questions: How can you model the cover of the sunglasses in SolidWorks?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University
Interview Descriptions: Direct online application. Go to SFU website and follow application procedure for each program. If you do not find any potential supervisor then it might be difficult to get the funding for covering tuition and living.
Interview Questions: Skype interview with potential supervisor

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked about all team related questions. How would you react to a particular situation. Like if someone is angry on to pick up an equipment and you're busy with someone on phone. How would you deal with situation. What skills of yours can benefit the organization, how your experience will help in building the organization stronger. Demonstrate your skills. Demonstrate on how to use a Microsoft widi adapter.
Interview Questions: How would you react to a particular situations. Expanded the question each time

title: Clinical Research Associate In Patient Reqruitment Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: That was not so heavy for me, because the job is not a well-paid and competitive position, For me, it was better than nothing, and I still was willing to do it as volunteer, because I neesd to be involved as soon as I can. The professor of the research is very considerate and really needs to hire an experienced health professional for running  their projects. May god grant him long life with dignity. However, I still look for more challenging positions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Desktop Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in May 2015

The latter portion was identifying parts of audio visual equipment and computer equipment as much of the work involves triaging hardware problems.  Following this, you are notified of whether the hiring was successful within a week.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with audio visual equipment before?

title: Grad Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Apr 2015

Interview Questions: tell me something about business process

title: Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1. The first stage of the process was by phone when I was interviewed by the recruiter who had initially let me know about the position.
2. The recruiter reported on our conversation to the Search Committee who were interested in hearing more so i was invited back for a face-to-face meeting with the recruiter
3. Follow-up interview with search committee (10 members)
4. I had a 2 day campus interview including 2 presentations, meetings with students, staff and faculty 2 x lunches with the search committee, a dinner and 2 x meetings with the VP academic.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where I was faced with harassment in the workplace and the strategies I used to address the problem.

title: Coordinator, MBA Student Relations & Career Programs - SFU Beedie School of Business Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Feb 2015

For the panel, there were 3 people representing the Beedie School of Business including 2 representing the Career Management Centre. The questions were mostly behavioural-based. I found the interviewers friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a client that was dissatisfied with the services provided.

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with my supervisor and discussed potential research topics. I spoke about what I was interested in and he discussed potential openings in the lab. Interview Questions: What about my research are you interested in.

title: Communications & Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Burnaby, BC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1-hour interview with a 3-4 person committee, in basket testing, intensive background check and they call all your references. having a portfolio is ideal but not requested. hr makes sure you qualify for every single job description.
Interview Questions: senario questions

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions:
After applying via email, I was emailed and asked to come in for an interview.  I was lead to a room where there were three people in the communications and marketing department who all had a long list of questions.  Each person went through their list, each on focusing on different topics (general, technical and how I would behave with co-workers/subordinates, etc.  

The interview was relaxed and I was told I could bring in samples of my portfolio and refer to them during the interview process.  

It lasted about 45 minutes and that was about it.

My interview was on a Tuesday and heard back from them on Friday.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a sensitive issue that was brought to me by the member of the public?

Interview Questions: What are some challenges and how have you overcome them

Interview Questions: Why were you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

The interview went more likely a chat, and the process went smoothly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

2) Individual interviews, pretty standard situational questions.
Interview Questions: Had to devise the proper response to an in-progress sexual assault.

title: Research Intern Interview

The interview is sort of organized, with about 30 min of questions - typical; like why you applied, talk about your research experience, lab experience, problem solving experience etc

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for this grad position like any other job: by sending a resume and cover letter. I got a call back weeks later and had an interview on the phone with one of my soon-to-be advisers. I was encouraged to contact other students in the lab, which I did. I also was able to call and chat with my primary adviser (who was not at the actual interview) before the interview to talk about what our research interests were to get a better idea of our fit. The phone interview was pretty standard, same general questions (greatest strengths/weaknesses, etc)
Interview Questions: What skills will you bring with you and what do you hope to learn?

title: Web Developer Interview

Interview Questions: Whether I coded and designed my portfolio from scratch or used one of the web-builder platforms.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Simon Fraser University (Vancouver, BC) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Initial contact was made by email from the Hiring Manager.

The interview was a panel interview (3 panelists) and lasted for approximately 40 minutes.  During the interview, a series of behavioural questions were asked that focused on organizational and communication skills.

Immediately after the interview there was an in-basket test which tested telephone, database and email communication skills as well as task prioritization.

Once the offer had been made, I was required to take a typing test to prove my typing speed.
Interview Questions: Excel spreadsheet work.

After interview, was put through a test that covered topics discussed in the interview. Included were things like prioritizing work schedules, mapping out how coordinator projects, etc.

Some questions about your previous works as well as your skills you put on your cv.
